metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3878 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in mod_auth_mellon before v0.14.2. If Apache is configured as a reverse proxy and mod_auth_mellon is configured to only let through authenticated users (with the require valid-user directive), adding special HTTP headers that are normally used to start the special SAML ECP (non-browser based) can be used to bypass authentication.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3878` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-auth-mellon - 0.14.2-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libapache2-mod-auth-mellon package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.14.2-1ubuntu1').
